**Variable**                | **definition of variable**
----------------------------|---------------------------------------------------
total blue space            | Total of all categories of blue spaces (water + wetlands).  
total green spaces          | Total of all categories of green spaces (forests + green urban areas).  
total blue and green spaces | Total of both green and blue space (forests, green urban areas, water, wetlands).  
Land use mix                | Mix consists of the following categories:
                                                        1. Built-up areas
                                                        2. Industrial & Commercial
                                                        3. Infrastructure
                                                        4. Ports
                                                        5. Green urban areas
                                                        6. Sports & leisure facilities
                                                        7. Agricultural areas
                                                        8. Other natural areas
                                                        9. Blue spaces
                                                        10. Other

# Built-environment - Urban-Atlas - urbanicity


### **Variable label**: Urbanicity grade (Urban Atlas)   
**Variable name**: physenv_ua_urbcy_0    
**Variable description**: Urbanicity grade based on the classes from the urban atlas. This is a categorical variable with 5 classes ranging from continuous urban to dense, medium, low, and very low density from Urban Atlas data.  
**Variable type**: integer  
**Variable unit**:   
**Category coding**:  

**physenv_ua_urbcy_0** | **Urbanicity grade (Urban Atlas)**
------------------------| --------------------------------------------------
1 | Continuous urban fabric (S.L. > 80%)  
2 | Discontinuous dense urban fabric (S.L.: 50% - 80%)  
3 | Discontinuous medium density urban fabric (S.L.: 30% - 50%)  
4 | Discontinuous low density urban fabric (S.L.: 10% - 30%)  
5 | Discontinuous very low density urban fabric (S.L.: < 10%)  

**Harmonization status**:  
**Harmonization comment**: UrbanAtlas data 2006  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}  
#This is where the R-script will be written  

```
